lexUnit.name: unsettle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to be anxious or uneasy; disturb.

sentence.text: His departure would further unsettle negotiations over loan guarantees with the IMF , already jittery about Brazil 's new economic plan .
` Yes , but one does n't want to unsettle the other cats , and Faustina herself might become upset . "
I recall the days when the unseen sounds of a muck spreader would seriously unsettle my solid cob .
People often worry about introducing a puppy into a home where there is already an aged Rottweiler , feeling that this will upset or unsettle the older dog .
Until this exchange the violent turn in Chant 's eye had never unsettled Estabrook , but it did now , preventing him as it did from meeting the other man 's gaze directly .
Besides , Alain Lemarchand had unsettled her .
He ` saw " himself , ludicrously ill-dressed for the narrow and rock-tumbled track , gaping like a foppish caricature of the Lake Tourist : but that did not unsettle him .
That their only recorded material is in rattly old tape format will no doubt unsettle the media-literate , fast-lane ` indie " kid of today .
The noise may have unsettled Kyle , for he bogeyed the 8th .
I 'm frightened now that it will unsettle me , bring back too many memories .
The car was brought to a sudden halt ; an inertial throw , catch , jerkiness unsettled the passengers ; fortunately their bodies responded safely .
` Constant security alerts and bomb scares do unsettle people .
Many Roman catholic clerics were unsettled by the plan .
On one of these outings , the nervous mare I was riding was already unsettled by strong winds .
BAT Industries was unsettled by news that rival Philip Morris expected a 40 per cent fall in tobacco profits and planned price cuts .
In other words , subordinates are unsettled by a boss who chops and changes between autocracy , persuasion , consultation and democracy .
The four riders who remained inside the compound were unsettled by the dogs , which ran among their horses causing them to buck and rear .
That statistic should unsettle those bankers now contemplating a merger .
Their very presence , however , unsettled the enemy and forced their commanders to detach valuable troops to round up the raiding parties .
Then , a couple of minutes later , it went totally silent , and that unsettled her even further .
Perhaps the sudden death of Father Hagan had unsettled him more than he knew .
That unsettled them all and made them wonder who would be the next to go .
He said : ` When we played last time we did n't have any problem , but here they tried to unsettle us because they were really frustrated .
